Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-HB2 (Phe-rich 31%; XXA; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis:  APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 76.9% similarity toPelophylaxin-4.  C2: molecular formula:  C78H112N14O14; Mol Wt 1469.833; GRAVY= 1.738; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide: -4.88 kcal/mol.Activity: Active against S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 150 uM), E. faecalis 981 (MIC 18.8 uM), N. asteroides 201118 (MIC 75 uM), P.aeruginosa CGMCC 1.50 (inactive; MIC>150 uM), K.pneumoniae 08040724 (inactive), E.coli ATCC 25922 (inactive), C.albicans ATCC 10231 (inactive), and C.glabrata 090902 (inactive). Updated 7/2021; 4/2022
Literature Information.Author: Xiao W, Shuguang R, Guo C, Weiqi Z, Xiaoli Z, Baowen Z, Sihan L, Jian R, Yuhong H, Wang H.2017
Literature Information.Title: Identification and functional analyses of novel antioxidant peptides and antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of four East Asian frog species.
